title: 108_hr2626
content: The "Farm-To-Cafeteria Projects Act of 2003" may be cited as the short title for this Act. Grants are provided to support farm-to-cafeteria projects. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to provide grants for farm-to-cafeteria projects, aiming to improve access to local foods in schools. Nonprofit entities and educational institutions can receive competitive grants to procure local foods from small and medium-sized farms for school meals. The amended Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act provides grants for farm-to-cafeteria projects to enhance access to local foods in schools. Grants support procurement of local foods from small and medium-sized farms for school meals, nutrition education activities, and the development of sustained farm-to-cafeteria projects in the community. Technical assistance may be provided for project implementation. The Secretary may share information on farm-to-cafeteria projects among government, private groups, and the public. Grants are provided to non-profit entities and educational institutions for farm-to-cafeteria projects. The grant provided for farm-to-cafeteria projects cannot exceed $100,000. The Federal share of project costs cannot exceed 75%, and the non-Federal share can be provided in cash or in kind. The farm-to-cafeteria project can be supported by a single grant not exceeding 3 years. The Secretary must evaluate the funded projects by January 30, 2008. The Secretary must provide a report on the evaluation results to the House of Representatives and the Senate Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2004 to 2009 for this purpose.
